result.execSummary:
The defendant Sheri L. Rondou was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Entry into Locked Building, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2015CF000175

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with K. Beltran and/or the premises of the Milty Wilty Drive-In Restaurant located in Wautoma, WI.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sheri L. Rondou

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Sheri L. Rondou
Current: 692 Sandcryst Av, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States  (Effective: 07-29-2016)
Prior: W6450 State Rd. 21, Wautoma, WI 54982

15CF-98, 15CF-175 and 15TR-1235 - All cases called @ 1:04 PM: Defendant Sheri L. Rondou in court, in custody, in person, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF-175:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Def agrees to allow counsel to appear via telephone today.  Counsel request matters go forward to resolution today.  Global resolution recited by ADA which will call for amendment to Misd level offenses.  SPD and Def confirm State's recital.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Court undertakes colloquy as to Misd amendments as to both cases.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CF-98 Court amends motion of the State to entry to a locked building contrary to s. 943.15(1) Plea:  NC.  15CF-175 Amended upon motion of the State to Misd level BJump - Plea:  NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Amendments conceptually aligned and to Def's benefit.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution.  S/W as to both matters - 18 mos probation.  Conditions:  No contact with K.B. and/or Milty Wilty located in Wautoma; Court Costs as to each case - 60 DTP or PP - DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.   15CF-175 - ID process will need to be completed.  Appeal Rights Given.   8 Days TS credit in the event of any Revocation proceeding.
from Atty Szilagyi requesting a telephonic appearance - Granted by the Court
Status conference at 12-15-2015 01:00 pm
Defendant and Atty Szilagyi appear via video.

RETURN ON WARRANT: Case called @ 1:20 p.m. Defendant Sheri L. Rondou in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant failed to appear for final pre-trial conference. Statement by Atty Szilagyi - DE was mistaken as to when she needed to return to court. DA Blader requesting $500 Cash Bond. Court orders $500 Cash Bond w/ conditions.  Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

3:00 pm case called. Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi makes statement regarding defendant. Court orders a warrant, Continental US. Court clears Jury trial from calendar.

11:22 am case called. Defendant Sheri L. Rondou in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to waive her right to a preliminary hearing. Court questions the defendant and accepts voluntary waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court receives plea.  Status conference scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:18 PM: Defendant Sheri L. Rondou in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing - 20 days.    Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing.   Pre-Liminary Hrg scheduled outside the 20 day window.  Pre-Lim Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 11:00 am.
State's
Defendant's
Initial appearance at 08-07-2015 02:15 pm

Case Called @ 1:35 PM: Defendant Sheri L. Rondou in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues as to Signature Bond of $25000 w/conditions.  Per SPD:  No objection to bond request of State - speaks to condition of Ab Sobriety and the appropriateness.   ADA argues as to Ab Sobriety conditions.  The Court:  Orders $2500 Signature Bond with conditions of no contact as requested only. Court will refrain to order standard "ABD" conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
